arm_group.description: Depressed Mothers randomized to experimental arm will undergo a 12 week group psychological intervention on the 'positive health programme'.
Depressed mothers randomized to TAU arm will receive treatment as usual.

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is an exploratory randomized controlled trial (RCT) of a group psychological
      intervention for postnatal depression in British mother's of south Asian origin. The aim is
      to evaluate the efficacy of a group psychological intervention (PHP) based on the principles
      of Cognitive Behaviour Therapy in treating depression in postpartum women. The hypothesis is
      that depressed British women of South Asian origin receiving the group intervention will
      show significant improvements in terms of severity of depression as compared to the
      treatment as usual (TAU) control group.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exploratory Trial of a Group Psychological Intervention for Postnatal Depression in British Mother's of South Asian Origin
condition: Postnatal Depression in British South Asian Women

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  self-ascribed British women of South Asian origin as defined by UK Office of
             -National Statistics,

          -  over the age of 16 years

          -  living with their babies,

          -  who meet the criteria for ICD-10 depression

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  women with diagnosed physical or learning disability,

          -  post-partum or other psychosis,

          -  severely depressed

          -  actively suicidal.

intervention.description: This study will evaluate the efficacy of a group psychological intervention (PHP) based on the principles of Cognitive Behaviour Therapy in treating depression in postpartum women.
intervention.intervention_name: Culturally adapted psychological intervention (Positive Health Programme)

address.city: Borough of Blackburn with Darwen; Burnley; Preston; Manchester

facility.name: Primary Care; Mother and Baby Clinics

investigator.last_name: Nusrat Husain, MBBS, Dip Psyche, MCPS (Psych)

clinical_study.official_title: Exploratory RCT of a Group Psychological Intervention for Postnatal Depression in British Mother's of South Asian Origin

other_outcome.description: Tool used to confirm the diagnosis of depression.

authority: United Kingdom: National Institute for Health Research

primary_outcome.measure: Edinburgh Post Natal Depression Scale (EPDS; Cox et al 1987)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments will be carried out at baseline, 3 months (end of intervention) and 6 months (The primary end point is 3 months).
